review_content: Interesting that they brand this as Stout, when it is actually a lager and only 5%.  It's neither a Stout or strong so a little misleading.   Actually is a black lager, but has some malt and sweetness to it, so feels and tastes kind of like a meltier brown ale.  Not sure if it's the ingredients or not fully attenuated, but has that extra sweetness.   There are some roasty flavors to balance out a bit, which sort of saves this beer.  Affordable price for a 6 @ H-Mart.   I could possibly get this again in the summer or something if I am craving something malty, light, and cheap.  Otherwise, it's an average brew at best.
Roast, pretty nice drinking. Pretty dry. Some raw barley. Black pour with ok head. Bitter finish. Decent stuff for style, surprisingly. Can at 7-11 in Hong Kong.
great taste and less filling type of lager.  canned in hong kong airport, contains alc.

Appearance: dark, tan head that falls away
Aroma: light aroma of roast malts
Palate: medium light mouthfeel, medium high carbonation 
Taste: pretty clean, light roast malts, clean bitterness
Restrained aroma in a coke coloured pour.  Light malty body makes an interesting change from the mass market lager - but is nothing more and/or no improvement.
The foamstability is low, body black. Aroma is darkmalty, roasty, a bit burned. The taste is a bit burned, some sweetness, darkmalty, soft. Ok, a bit weird and unbalanced but ok.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Can at HK airport. Aroma of faint roast, and dark malt. Taste is slightly sweet.

Sampled from a can at one of the lounges at Hong Kong Airport. Dark brown, near black, with a tan head. Sweet lager-like taste with mild notes of chocolate. Some roasted flavours and bitterness at the very end. Very thin mouthfeel, almost like drinking coca-cola. Not very nice.

Can. Dark brown, small to average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and caramel sweetish aroma, light bread and burnt malt and faint licorice. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light bread and roasted malt and faint licorice and metal. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, light bread and roasted malt with faint licorice, light metal. Watery schwarzbier with notes of sharp metal.

330ml bottle
Dark brown/black pour with OK tan head.
Crystal/roasted malt aroma.
Slight bitterness, quite sweet with malty palate.
Not sure why they put the word STOUT on the bottle but an OK Schwarzbier anyway.
Bottle. Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma - Earthy, choc, bread. Taste - Sweet, bread, licorice, malt.

A dark brown Schwartz bier with a thin brown head. In aroma, light chocolate malt with light caramel notes, light mineral notes, OK. In mouth, sweet nutty chocolate malt with light caramel, light German hops, light mineral notes, actually not bad. Can at skyteam lounge, Hkg airport

Piwo 5 dni przed końcem daty, mocno utlenione. W zapachu marmolada śliwkowa i lekki grafit, do tego nieco słodu i karmelu. W smaku dominuje karmel, nieco kakao, słody, ponownie marmolada śliwkowa, rodzynki, lekki grafit i mokry karton. Słodkie. Do wypicia, nie jest takie złe, chociaż to pewnie efekt utlenienia.
Summer backlog #17 spodziewałem sie większej masakry. karmel, żelazo, leciutka kawowość, słodycz w sam raz. jak za złoty pisiąt na promce to bardzo dobry strzał.

Interesting that they brand this as Stout, when it is actually a lager and only 5%. It's neither a Stout or strong so a little misleading. Actually is a black lager, but has some malt and sweetness to it, so feels and tastes kind of like a meltier brown ale. Not sure…
Roast, pretty nice drinking. Pretty dry. Some raw barley. Black pour with ok head. Bitter finish. Decent stuff for style, surprisingly. Can at 7-11 in Hong Kong.
great taste and less filling type of lager.  canned in hong kong airport, contains alc.
Appearance: dark, tan head that falls away Aroma: light aroma of roast malts Palate: medium light mouthfeel, medium high…
Restrained aroma in a coke coloured pour.  Light malty body makes an interesting change from the mass market lager - but is nothing more and/or no improvement.
The foamstability is low, body black. Aroma is darkmalty, roasty, a bit burned. The taste is a bit burned, some sweetness, darkmalty, soft. Ok, a bit weird and unbalanced but ok.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnień z degustacji w ramach uzupełnienia profilu.
Can at HK airport. Aroma of faint roast, and dark malt. Taste is slightly sweet.

Sampled from a can at one of the lounges at Hong Kong Airport. Dark brown, near black, with a tan head. Sweet lager-like taste with mild notes of chocolate. Some roasted flavours and bitterness at the very end. Very thin mouthfeel, almost like…

Can. Dark brown, small to average and mostly diminishing light brown head. Moderate, malty and caramel sweetish aroma, light bread and burnt malt and faint licorice. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light bread and roasted…
330ml bottle Dark brown/black pour with OK tan head.…
Bottle. Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma - Earthy, choc, bread. Taste - Sweet, bread, licorice, malt.

A dark brown Schwartz bier with a thin brown head. In aroma, light chocolate malt with light caramel notes, light mineral notes, OK. In mouth, sweet nutty chocolate malt with light caramel, light German hops, light mineral notes, actually not bad. Can at skyteam…

Piwo 5 dni przed końcem daty, mocno utlenione. W zapachu marmolada śliwkowa i lekki grafit, do tego nieco słodu i karmelu. W smaku dominuje karmel, nieco kakao, słody, ponownie marmolada śliwkowa, rodzynki, lekki grafit i mokry karton. Słodkie. D…
Summer backlog #17 spodziewałem sie większej masakry. karmel, żelazo, leciutka kawowość, słodycz w sam raz. jak za złoty pisiąt na promce to bardzo dobry strzał.
Po co tak ściemniać na etykiecie? Wpierw widzę napis "stout", żeby za chwilę doczytać, że to "lager type". WTF?

Pours very dark brown with a beige and fizzy head which disappears quickly. Malty aroma with notes of bread, nuts and a hint of caramel. Bittersweet taste with roasted malts, chocolate and somehow artificial bitter flavours. High carbonation, thin and watery overall. The first one was enough of this stuff. (355ml can at HKG airport lounge)
Can from a 7-11 in Sham Shui Po. Very dark, nearly black. Slightly roasted aroma. Taste has some caramel in it, too. Forgettable.

Czarny z brunatnymi refleksami, piana słaba. Aromat lekko torfowy, lekko palony, lekko alkoholowy, nieco kukurydziany, generalnie płytki. Smak rozwodniony, kwas paloności, słabsza kawa, niezłożony, nic ciekawego. Nie pije się przyjemnie. Nie polecam.

Bottle. Head is initially small, frothy/fizzy, light brown, mostly diminishing. Body is dark brown to black. Aroma is moderately malty (roasted/burnt grain, cocoa powder), with light notes of leather and minerals. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively/fizzy carbonation.

I’d call this a Schwarzbier, personally. Not only based on the aromatic character and mouth experience, but also considering Hite is largely a lager brewery. Regardless, it’s a better beer than I expected; while simple, the aroma is not unpleasant, and quite roasty. Similarly, while it could use more bitterness, it’s easily quaffable and reasonably clean for a macro brew. UPDATE: on the Hite website, they do admit this is a lager. As I suspected, the word "stout" does not in this case indicate style, but rather just robustness.

Aromat słaby wręcz nieprzyjemny. pachnie jak typowy ciemny lager. Nut palonych, stoutowych tutaj nie ma. 
W smaku jest lepiej , jest paloność, ale z mocną nutą słodową.
Jest słodko-kwaskowy, z wyraźnym słodkawym posmakiem. 
Słabe to piwo. 
Nie powinno nazywać się stout. 
Skrobia kukurydziana w składzie, fuj!

Bottle from Guodinglu supermarket in Shanghai. Pours light reddish brown -should probably be rated as a vienna or schwarzbier ( translating "stout" has its issues). Aroma is fragrant roasty and nutty. Flavor is simple and a bit light on the palate, some sweet notes, a bit sugary where it should be malty, but finishes with a drier note of roasted that can be appreciated on its own terms. Good, but can’t be held up to any kind of craft standard for obvious reasons.
Butelka 330ml. Barwa ciemno rubinowa, przejrzysta. W aromacie pieczywo. Bardzo wodniste. Słabe.

Pours black ruby colour with medium brownish head. Strong aroma of dark bread, coal. Medium bitter, medium sweet, no sourness. Light body, average carbonization, medium lasting burned bitter aftertaste
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Dramat.

(Bottle)Aroma:roasted malt,dark bread, milk chocolate,nuts,dark chocolate.Appearance:dark brown color,small off white head.Taste:medium-sweet,flavour of roasted malt, caramel, coca cola, strange artificial toffee finish.Palate:light body,medium carbonation,wateryOverall:Meeh ,poor attempt,way to watery.
Can at the Singapore Airlines Silverkris Lounge at HKG Airport. Almost black with a small head. Thin with some light roasted notes, caramel and hints of fruit. Nothing to write home about.

From bottle it’s clear dark brown with a short off-white head. Simple malt aromatics manifest as dark caramel simple, cookie batter, charred grain, with touches of butter (diacetyl) and some metallic quality that seems phenolic. In the mouth it’s light bodied, watery and fizzy, thin and limp with minimal hop expression.
Nie jest to stout, raczej schwarzbier, i w tej kategori jet nieźle. Chlebowy, palone słody, słonecznik, wysycenie średnie, gładkie w odczuciu i o dziwo nie jest słodkie, zaznaczona goryczka
Butelka. Aromat piwnica, ciemne słody. W smaku pijalne, wodniste, minimalne kwaśne. Nic specjalnego.

Zapach mało intensywny, słód, chleb, karmel. Kolor ciemnobrunatny, klarowne. Piana beżowa, niska, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, szybko znika. W smaku lekka słodycz, niska pełnia, słód, cola, lukrecja, karmel. Goryczka niska, wysycenie wysokie.

Z wyglądu niezbyt ciemne, jak na stouta. Piana jakaś niby była, ale już jej nie ma. Nawet nie wącham. Piję.


 Smak. Tutaj posłużę się cytatem z filmu "Bagdad Cafe". Niemka, która utknęła z walizkami gdzieś na bezdrożach USA, pije na stacji benzynowej kawę. Wychyla pierwszy łyk i z obrzydzeniem mówi: "This is not coffee. This is brown water."


 Piwo da się wypić bez większych skrzywień.
Dark brown, medium head. Aroma of caramel, milk, coffe, roasted malt. Medium body, lagerish, sweet, caramel, some coffee. Not that bad dunkel.

Bottle. Dark brown, clear with small and quickly disappearing beige head. Aromas of dark bread on light malty background. Similar notes in taste, neither sweet not bitter, maybe little bit sour finish, very light, water like, body.
W aromacie ciemne pieczywo. Barwa ciemno brunatna, piana niska. W smaku puste, odrobina palonych i chlebowych posmaków poza tym wodniste, nieco kwaskowate.

Barwa ciemnobrunatna, rubinowe refleksy. Piana jasna, dość szybko opada. W aromacie pustka, jedynie przypieczona skórka od chleba. W smaku wyraźny chlebowy aromat, lekka nuta palonych słodów. Trochę wodniste.

Dåse. Hotelgrund i Seoul, minder mig om Malta for 10 år siden. Prøver desperat at prøve øl men de er det samme. Denne er dog betydelig bedre end rygtet og slår en del mikrobryggeri scouts, men dertil når højderne også. Rerate. Efter at have fået den et par gange slår det mig at det ikke er en stout men en scwartzbier. Dette er understreget af at der står lagertype på dåsen. Stadig fin øl.

35 cl can in Seoul. Dark brown color, clear, soapy beige head, fizzy.
Aroma of sweet burn malts, with charcoal and dust.
Sweetish taste with some metallic bitterness. Dusty finish.
Cheap stout, similar to a malzbier.

This is a cheap stout, one of the cheapest options in a supermarket here in HK, with a 6 pack sold for HKD 34. But I have to say that its value is amazing,
It pours black with a nice white head. Aroma is a bit acidic, with strong roasted malts. Taste is roasted malts, some coffee and dark chocolate. Finish is bitter, medium-light body, excellent value for its price!

Dark brown colour. No head. Sweetness, caramel malts in aroma. Slightly bitter and watery beginning. Slight bitterness also in the middle. Slighlt bitter and weird finish. There is no particular characteristics. Very watery beer. Bad.

Dark. Light body. A rather clean malt profile with faint roasted notes. A bit of caramel malt and some cocoa. The can I had said Lager Type, which makes me think this is a schwarbier and not a stout. The flavor profile fits a schwarz, too. Decent option in a watery lager wasteland.

Bottle from a strangely set up convenience store in Tainan, Taiwan.
Cool and into a snifter. Ruby cola in body and shimmers in the lights. head holds for a good minute; a tannish inch of foam. Rusty swarf, dusty cocoa, fresh wort, blood and dark wood on the nose. Super buttery, diacetyl fueled palate. Lagered? It tastes of raw cake mix. Yeasty, bready with a good base of chocolate malt. Light carbonation and medium light bodied. Very softly spoken, with an odd lingering perfume of strawberries and cherries. Weird but drinkable. Undemanding on all counts! (33cL Bottled 03/04/15, Puro [?], Hai’an road, Tainan, Taiwan)
Can in HK as Black Beer Stout. Neutral sweetish beginning. Dry malty, no depth. Malty-watery, hints of sweetness, strange with no bitterness.
Malty with a sweet molasses flavor. Bitter-sweet after flavor. Like a sweet Guinness. Drinkable but nothing special.

500ml can at the Silverkrisflyer Lounge in Hong Kong - labelled Black Beer Stout. Almost black in colour with a thin beige head. Thin body, with aroma of malt and molasses. Roasted malt caramel flavour - close to a Guinness foreign draft. Not bad - drinkable.
Butelka wypita w KoreiPłd w 2009r. Kolor cfiemno-brązowy z małą pianą. Zapach orzechowo-karmelowy. Smak lekko czekoladowy, słodkie piwo.
Aroma of malt and molasses, pours a dark brown color with a lasting tan foamy head modest lacing. Sweet taste of molasses and malt full bodies with a sickly sweet malt after taste.

11.13 oz bottle. Aroma is earthy, chocolate, wet river rock, licorice, bready. Pours dark brown with a collapsing beige head that falls into a ring of big-bubbly foam. Taste is sweet, bready, licorice, slightly oxidized. Body is thin, watery. Not too bad, really.
Half lager half stout, rather closer to the Dark lager. But the taste is not nasty. Liquid course and the balance is bad, but you can drink

Bottle o.33 l, Carrefour, Wrocław, Poland.
Ciemnobrązowe piwo o jasnobeżowej, puszystej pianie oraz karmelowo-czekoladowym, lekko kwaskowym aromacie. W smaku wodniste z kawowym posmakiem.

Bottle from a Korean supermarket. Pours a dark brown color with a small white head. A light nutty nose. The flavor is fine: cola, brown malts, nutty, some sweet chocolates. Pretty drinkable. More of a brown ale.
Clear dark ruby, small light brown foam head. Light coffee aroma, watery taste for a stout. Shirt light bitter coffee aftertaste. (Velp 201412)
Can at premium lounge, hong kong. Clear almost black color, tanned head. Aroma is light roasty. Taste is light roasty, nothing else.
330ml bottle. Pours black with a small head. Seems more like a schwarzbier to me. It doesn't even look like a stout. That said, it is not too bad.

To jakas pomylka. Zdecydowanie nie przypomina Stouta. Bardziej jak dark lager lub Schwarzbier. Ale srednie piwa w tym stylu sa lepsze od tego. Mala piana do tego blyskawicznie znika. Pelno refleksow czerwieni wiec nie tak gesty jak stout byc powinien. Zabawna oszukancza nazwa bo to piwo dolnej fermentacji. Malo wytrawne i zero palonosci, malo wyraziste, a za slodkawe i slodowe. Czekolada na zakonczenie w oszczednej ilosci. piwo bardzo malo geste i bardzo jasne jak na styl ktory powinno reprezentowac. Nie polecam bo to sciema

This is not a stout. I have trouble getting a get smell - a bit of hops but none of the expected coffee, smoke, etc. Photo shows the expected transparent look - not a really dark beer and the head is just white- no tan as expected from a stout. For taste there is just a bit of smoke or charcoal and otherwise nothing, Mouth feel is just absent, might at well be a pale lager. Not my idea of a Stout, but if you’re in Korea it is’t the worst you can do!!

Barwa: ciemna, pod światło rubinowa, klarowna. Piana beżowa, drobno pęcherzykowa, niewielka, dość szybko opadająca i pozostająca jedynie przy ściankach. 

Aromat: zdecydowanie słodowy. Ciemne słody, lekka kwaskowość, melanoidyny, karmel. Mimo wszystko dość złożony, ale mało wyrazisty. 

Smak: słodowy, raczej lekki i słodki. Karmel, czekolada, melanoidyny, a więc zdecydowanie w stylu dark lagera lub scharzbiera. 

Wynalazek rodem z Korei, zakupiony w jednym z hipermarketów. Nazwa brzmi dość zabawnie, zwłaszcza w aspekcie dopisku lager type. Podobne piwo (dolnej fermentacji) warzył niegdyś rodzimy browar Południe, ale ono chociaż przypominało w smaku stout. Tutaj natomiast mamy do czynienia z jednym ze wspomnianych wyżej stylów, nawet przyzwoitym. Do tego cena także nie najgorsza. Jako lekkie piwo na lato, jak znalazł.

Dark carmel pour. Gets more black in the glass. Filmy, oily head. Aroma is caramel malt. Soft mouthfeel. Tastes like dark, roasted malt and like a black lager, not a stout. Not bad for an airport lounge.

Aroma: dark malts.
Appearance: clear dark brown color, white head.
Taste: low bitterness, dark malts, a little bit sweet, there are no stout notes.
Palate: low body and high carbonation.
Overall: Strange stuff. Something like schwarzbier without fireworks.

12 oz bottle at Hmart.. No head or lacing.. Carbonization is OK. Has some aspects of a stout.. But I don’t think this is really a stout.. kind of like a light beer laced with a stout.. But stouts are my favorite so I kinda toned down my score on this one as far as a stout is concerned.

6 pack of 12 oz bottles from H-mart in Plano. Poured a black with a very thin tan top and no lacing. Taste of roasted malt, slight skunk, void of flavor mostly. High carbonation, medium body. This is a stout??

Can. Pours black with an off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruitiness and roasted malt. Flavor is sweet and malty with some caramel, roasted notes and nuts. Medium to thin body, average carbonation.

Pours a thin head on a black body.
The aroma is roasted malt, simple and one-sided but not bad.
The taste is roasted malt with some lemon bitterness to round it out.
The texture is crisp with moderate carbonation.
It drinks more like a dark lager than a stout. Not bad.

355 ml can as “Hite Black Beer Stout” bought at Market Place by Jason’s in K11, Tsim Sha Tsui.



Clear, Cola-like blackish brown colour; One -quarter finger head and light beige foam which fades in 20 seconds; Small sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation; Pungent smell of lager malt, with light nuts, faint cream, light hint of chocolate, mustiness, yeast, and very strong straw; Close to zero sweet taste of roast malt, with nuts, light black coffee, very light toffee, light cardboard, light bread, lime, light bitter hops, and very strong straw; Light body, watery palate; Mouth feel is somewhere between a watery macro Amber Lager and Schwarzbier. Very lager-like body, with fairly light touch of roast malt, coffee, toffee and cream. Some wet paper and bready, and the rather bugging strawy hops. Ugh… Hoppiness is very strawy nose, lime and nasty straw in taste. Extract-like bitterness came through as the beer gets warmer for a lasting, light astringent finish; Fairly dry after taste. Papery and astringent to mouth.



Comments: This one tastes much like a jacked-up macro Schwarzbier: lagery, grassy, light nuts and coffee tastes. The slightly off musty nose, wet paper taste and annoying straw hops aside, this one tastes quite okay as a Schwarz. Don’t even think of it as a Stout, or else disappointment awaits.

Poured from bottle to glass. Dark jet black with off white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is massive cola, malt, yeast esthers, floral notes. Mouthfeel is good due to medium-light body with above-average carbonation. Taste is malty sweet with a slight CO2 bite finish. Little bitterness and quite esthery from the yeast. Overall, this is a decent beer but nothing spectacular and quite one-dimensional.
hazy sepia, thin white ring. Nose is thin tea, light roast, sugar balancing all. Flavor sweet with light bubblegum, wort hints all over, pretty soft overall. Thin and sticky.

330mL thanks to radagast83. Pours a clear, deep tea brown with good foam. Good lace. Nose is sugary, maple, smoke, sweet apple. Taste is roasty, ashy, chalky, dry, sweet. Palate is weak, watery, mildly tart. More of a brown ale.

12oz bottle pours a watery black with some cloudy off white head. Nose of dried malt, pumpernickel bread, licorice, a little mint. Flavor is malty, minty, licorice, sweet, peppery. Clean finish. Could be worse.

Bottle, thanks radagast83. Brown-black body with medium beige head. Aroma is medium sweet, bittersweet chocolate, some caramel. Taste is medium sweet, bittersweet chocolate, some caramel. Light-medium body, low carbonation.

Bottle shared by Radagast83. Pours clear dark brown with a small, fizzy off-white head, short retention with no lacing. Aroma is toast and chocolate malt, dates, earthy and spicy hops. Flavor is dark malt with light hops and bitterness, dark fruits and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.

Drank this once while in South-Korea in 2007. Roasty, toast, coffee, slight hint of citrus and herbs, dough, opaque dark brown, tiny head that does stick, medium sweet, toasted malt, hints of coffee and chocolate, light sourness, surprisingly light-bodied, creamy, sweetbitter finish, nice beer, kinda light version stout

Can at Dean’s stickiest floor tasting. Pours a very dark brown beer with a very small, beige head. Very clear pour. Aroma is roasted coffee and malts and the flavor is mildly sweet and quite uninteresting. Could session this beer for it’s good drinkability and low abv, but that’s about it..
Can. Aroma is big roasted malt. Flavour is roasty malt, some liquorice. Not too bad i guess.
Can shared at THT. Pours clear red brown with a tan head. Aroma of malt, raisins, fruits. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.

Can at Deano’s monthly tasting, September. Poured a deep mahogany with a glass hugging tan head. The aroma is weak roasted malt. The flavour is weak bitter with a malty liqourice palate. A truly awful example of the style.
Can. Pours dark brown. Aroma is coffee and meat. Taste is medium sweet. Pretty bad. Hint of urine aswell.

33cl can shared courtesy of Sic1314.
Almost no head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Too thin for a stout
Poured a light reddish brown with a frothy off white head. Aroma of dark chocolate and roast malt. Medium to light body, flavour of the aroma with a dry, bitter finish.

Bought this from a local Super H Mart. Poured more of a dark, cola color with small off-white head. Okay first off, this was drinkable and went well with my homemade Korean dinner, but I wouldn’t call this a stout. Don’t get me wrong, it might be a stout but all I could think of while drinking this was "Vienna lager." Aroma is light roasted malts, mild sweetness in there. Flavor was light malts, some light roast notes. Crisp and pretty clean.

Pours black with fizzy cream-tan head that fades to film. In the porter color range rather than the stout, glints of garnet apparent. Aroma is strawberry, light wet hay, hint of burnt coffee. Flavor is broccoli, old dry hay, dirt... watery and bland. Seltzer water aftertaste. body is light with moderate prickly carbonation.

330ml can (Convenience store, Suwon) - shared by the Hel posse - thanks!

Dark, a bit fizzy. Unpleasant dirty roast aroma. Even worse in the taste. Nasty and watery. Even 1/4 of a can was too much - DP’ed it.

(Can, 0.33 l, courtesy of FatPhil, 20130713) The beer poured deep dark brown and clear. Its head was medium sized and lightly brown. Aroma had roasted malts and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were roasted malts, sweetness, paper and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. Not a completely bad brew but still leaves a lot to hope for.
Can "Black beer stout" 0.33l, thanks to FatPhil. Colour is black with small brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee and roasted malts. Very thin and watery.

Can, under the name of "Black Beer Stout". Nose is lighter than I’d expect for the style, but has a nice bit of roasting to it and just a hint of pseudo-sourness you’ll often get in RISs. Taste also has some nice roasting bordering on a coffee bitterness. Actually a pretty good stout, IMHO.

Share of a bottle. Thanks, Timmy! Dark brown pour, with a small, tan head. The aroma is weak chocolate, and a note or cough syrup - maybe grape or cherry. Very sweet flavor, with no hop bitterness. Light body, watery, and weak. Overall, this is a poor attempt at a stout. Needs a better malt profile, and any hop profile at all.
Black coloured beer with small white head and no carbonation visible. Roasted aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is roasted sweet.

Bottle of Black Beer Stout Lager from emart in Seoul. Just 1040 won, it pours a dark brown with a tan head. It has a strong roast malt coffee-ish aroma but the flavor is mostly lager hay/grass followed by a bit of caramel & roast dark malt flavor. It is ok but more of a dark lager. It is by no means a stout, very grassy & a twist top which I hadn’t seen in awhile.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle at Honey Pig Centreville.  It pours black with lots of red highlights and a short lived head.  The nose has a bit of roasted malt and coffee.  The flavor follows suit, more akin to a schwarzbier than a stout.  Light to medium body with a pretty crisp finish.  High drinkable and not a bad pairing with my Korean barbecue.
dark brown black colored body with a small off white head and a sweet malt flavor a malt spicy dry bitter taste with a bitter finish

In Hong Kong, as "Black Beer Stout". It’s a lager, as it says on the can. But the aroma is a bit porty, a bit plumish. Not bad for a lager. The style could be an error here, as this is a stout as the Meantime London Stout is. Flavours are a bit loose into water. Roasted malts, a bit of chocolate, and a very very feeble bitterness. Thin bodied, but still with a chalky feel. Not sufficiently stout, but infinitely better than the Qindao (Tsingtao?) Stout I had on the same day.

(12oz bottle, labeled Black Beer Stout, courtesy of blutt59)  Pours a brown body with a small fizzy beige head.  Aroma of chocolate, graham cracker, and ash.  Flavor of caramel, chocolate, caramel, light ash, and roasted malt.

Bottle. Pours clear dark reddish black with a small fizzy off white head that dissipates immediately. Aroma is dark roasted malts and a bit of coffee and molasses. Flavor about the same, medium sweet with very little bitterness. Quite watery in the mouth, with a bit of an odd aftertaste.

Had no idea this was Korean when I stuck it in a pick-6. Turns out is miles better than the regular Hite beer I had a few months back. Pours not at all stout, more like a dark lager complete with relatively fizzy head. Aroma is sweet and roasted malt. Taste has some chocolate and roastiness but again nothing close to "stout" territory. Still, not bad overall.

aroma is of just malt, kind of roasty, light alcohol
its dark brown, largely opaque with a tiny pale lace that does stick around a bit. it distinctly is a bit smoother and less aggressively fizzy than yellow fizzy pee beer, but is still a macro. taste is a tiny touch of dark chocolate, roastiness though overall taste is a bit rough and nondescript.

this is hands down the hidden gem in south korea, because its also only costs about 5-15% more than the cheapest ultra name brands put out by hite and OB.
bottle,  dark brown with no head, chocolate roasted aroma with a bit of dirt and prune flavor added, sweet

(12oz bottle dated 09-02-13 thanks to blutt59) clear medium brown, ring of creamy tan bubbles. Nose of cream, ashy roasty malt, smooth chocolate smell, very light dark fruit. Taste of Light roasty chocolate malt, bit of honey, smooth and creamy, saccharin finish.

Bottleas Black Beer Stout. Black coloured beer with lots of carbonation and a small brown head. Sweet suggary liccorice wattery malty and slightly roasted hinted aroma. Medium palate. Finish is light malty sweet with a rather short ending. Medium.
As the imaginatively named Black Beer Stout in a can for free in HK airport lounge. Light mouthfeel with caramelly burnt flavors. Very harsh carbonation.

Okay
..........okay
Okay
..........okay
Okay
..........okay
Okay
..........okay
Okay

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a dark red-brown with a fast-dissipating head. Very little on the nose -- can’t tell it’s a stout at all, really. Just smells like beer. Some coffee notes on the tongue, but without the richness and depth I expect from stout. Really more of a black lager, and even then it’s too weak; utterly lacking the substance and silkiness I want from stout. Enh.

Well this is about as light as a stout can get. The flavors and aromas aren’t bad, just very light. Looks like Pepsi when poured into a glass, with no head and a dark brown/amber body. Thin watery body. This is always my drink of choice when doing heavy drinking at bars.
Pours a deep cola color with aroma of roasted malt.  Taste is very clean, roasted nut taste, with minimal aftertaste. A very drinkable beer surprisingly light beer for a stout.

33cl bottle, courtesy of Joes. Almost black colored beer with a small beige head. Smell malts, earth, ash, cigar and piss. Taste malts, ash, earth, yeast, dough. Not good at all imo. Low carbo, low body.
(bottle) clear dark brown with small tan head; faint aroma of roast; weak flavour, watery

Very thin head, very black body. Oh boy - another macro stout. It has the aroma of barley and grass in a swampland. The flavour is a murkey mess of sweet barley buried under an ocean of water. They completely dropped the ball on this stout.

0.33l can. A Korean stout you say huh? Well, let’s try: Pours a dark brown - near black body with a small quickly fading beige head. Sweet and caramely on the aroma, some hints of thin cardboard and cold coffee. It has a soft to average carbonation level and  a thin watery mouthfeel. Roasted and watered down flavors here. Some cold coffee, caramel, cardboard, metal and it has a OK hoppy bitterness. Ends with a burned flavor and a both sweet and dry finish and aftertaste. Not horrible to drink - especially after only drinking pale lagers for almost a week!
Bottle as Black Beer Stout. Pours black with garnet hilites and a beige head. Med body. Flavor is a little bitter chocolate and some smooth burnt malt. Nice.
Can as Black Beer Stout. Dark brown medium diminishing tan head. Aroma is malt, little roasted malts and caramel. Flavour is malt, light roasted malts, chocolate, caramel and medium sweet.
Clear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty and caramel. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter. Watery. 221211
Can. Nice head with short duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are caramel, malt and water.
Thanks to SHIG.  Dry stout with a little chocolate and a slight smoke in the finish.  Really, not too bad.

Can courtesy of ryan.  Pours a clear, almost honey tinted brown color.  Aroma of mild roast and coffee.  Lightly sweet when it first hits the tongue.  Fades to a dry bitter finish.  Nots of roasted malt and smoke.

deep dark brown and has a light cherry and amber hue at  the margins with a n off white head that is vibrant and retains a bit for some time. an initial aroma of fruit more cherry with a hint of soy. This aroma molts toward metal after just a couple of minutes. co2, metal, and  malt with vibrant small carbonation. alcohol with some light imitation nut like sweetness. finish feels a little scotch or butterscotch and lingers as brew becomes watery.
Can: Poured a light black brown with a huge beige head. Strong malt aroma on pour, some gritty bitterness as well. sweet malt up front leaves to a bitter grittiness. Finish is a bit chewing tobacco.
Can.  Clear dark brown, no head to speak of.  Aroma of burnt wood.  Taste is bitter root.  Unpleasant.

Can labeled "Black Beer Stout". I’m putting my rating here rather than under the black beer listing as I’m pretty sure they should be aliased, but who knows. Move this if needed.... 

 Dark brown/amber body with a small lasting off-white head. Light aroma of dark fruit, some toffees and sweet honey malts. Taste is fairly dry, lightly dry, a brief hint of prune and some toffee, very light grassy hops. Finish is a bit metallic and watery, with a some biting carbonation, and reminds you this is still a macro. Still, not terrible, and a solid choice for drinking in Korea.

355 ml can as Black Beer Stout. From Malaysia.

Dark mahogany colour with small light tan head.
Aroma is mild malty with sugary esthers and window cleaner. 
Flavour is also malty with some sugary sweetness.
Thin and sugary. Well, Stout this ain’t.
Nasty cheap beer I drank in South Korea, very rough and badly brewed, its great for getting you drunk quickly and helping you to move on to the soju

(As Black beer) Dark red-brown colored, little light brown head. Sweet caramelly aroma with thin roastiness, still too sweet for me. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is also roasted with thin licorice in start, same sweetness dominates here. Well, some stoutish notes, but not too much.

330mL bottle, twist-off cap.  Dark brown pour, bright white fizzy head.  Aroma of roasted cereal.  Light burnt grain aroma.Thin flavor of roasted malt.  Light sweetness, nice roast.  Light bodied.  Not much of a Stout, more like a Schwarzbier.  

5,2,3,2,10
Bottle. Dark brown with a small, tan head. Sweet, roasted malts aroma and flavours. Sweeter in the mouth, molasses. Drinkable, but little substance.
[RBESG, Sheffield] Grand Tasting @ The Halequin, Sheffield. Brown color, nutty aroma. Flavor was way off, some caramel. Very thin. More of a brown ale and def. not a stout.

330ml Bottle – 99 Bottles – Federal Way, WA  

Aroma: Light dark malt not very roasty. 

Appearance: Dark borwn in color, clear with a thin head.  

Flavor: Off flavors this tasted odd and was not near a stout but they tried.   

Palate:  Dry off finish with a OK Mouthfeel.  

Overall: Not super tasty this was just not a good bottle of beer.

Bottle: &nbsp Nearly black, pale black coffee in color, thin sudsy off-white head, spotty lacing, light carbonation. &nbsp For a stout it seems a bit translucent, or should I say it is not all that thick. &nbsp Pale roasted malt 

nose, slightly lactic, otherwise a barnish funk. &nbsp Thin, thin, thin... doesn’t taste like a stout. &nbsp This is, at best, a Dark/Black bier. &nbsp Dusty, musty, very basement like in its maltiness. &nbsp Has a pale lactose like 

sweetness. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are certainly on the thin side. &nbsp Extremely light for a stout. &nbsp Not what I expected. &nbsp Pretty much a Black Bier. &nbsp As a Stout... forget it.

[bottle at RBESG 2009, Grand Tasting]
Slightly nutty aroma with some brown sugar. Clear dark chestnut appearance with a white ring. Slight nutty brown sugar flavour with a sweetness in balance with medium carbonation. Light body, clean finish.

From the Bottle at RBESG Harlequin, Sheffield 19/07/2009
Some chocolate aroma. Carbonation. Amber mid brown coloured and fruity with a little bitterness in a dry caramel finish.

Labelled "Black beer." Deep red-black with poofy, beige, root beer float head. MIldly malty and roasty aroma though mostyl neutral. Light  to medium roastiness, interesting grain character with some cough syrup notes. Light cough syrup, roast finish that slightly numbs the mouth.

Can. 
Pretty nice color. Not quite the opaque, pitch black of the better stouts Very thin nose. Smells a bit sweet, little hop aroma. Quite like a Japanese "black."  Slight burnt, stout-like flavor, but very weak on hops and malt. Not much of the burnt taste, either. Not a terrible beer overall, quite drinkable in fact, especially for the price of about ¥156. No where near a good stout, though. Fails in that category. Not near enough flavor of any kind.
Bottle at RBESG grand tasting. Very dark brown lasting beige head. Some toffee watery some malts. Fine. Mild

Store had one marked down to $1, so I went for it for fun.  Honestly not that bad for what I was expecting.  Funny how you can see through the stout though ;&#41 .  Lightly sweet, light lightly chocolate, and definitely a tiny roast bitterness to the finish.  First Korean beer rated too!

[RBESG, Sheffield]
Grand Tasting @ The Halequin, Sheffield... brown ... thin tan head ... light roast malt nose... toffee malts and litle roast

[RBESG, Sheffield]

Grand Tasting  @ The Halequin, Sheffield.

Pours clear brown with a small, creamy, beige head. Soft roasted aroma and lots of sweetness. Low carbonation, thin mouthfeel. Sweet, sticky, sugary flavour, some rye bread and mildly roasted.
Bottle at the RBESG09 Grand Tasting, Sheffield. Alround rating: Caramel over pale malt exstract, herbal hop exstract does balance due to the carbaonion being uite high. Thin but drinkable stuff.
Bottle @ RBESG Grand Tasting 2009. Dark brown color. Caramel aroma. caramelly, slightly roasted sweetish grainy flavor. Average.

RBESG Sheffield 2009 Grand Tasting at the Harlequin. Amber brown colour, light off white head. Aroma of caramel, some sweet stuff. Flavour is sweet, malty, caramel, bit of toasted malts. Sweet finish. Light to medium bodied. Not bad, but this is a dunkel at best, not a stout.
Pours a clear brown color with a light brown head.  Aroma is malty, chocolate, toffee, caramel, and slightly earthy.  Flavor is roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, and a bitter earthy finish.

Deep brown coloured body with a thinnish tan head. Aroma of light caramel, roasted malt, coffee and a bit of nuts - not bad at all. Light to Medium-bodied; Strong roasty flavour with toffee and a watery nutty flavour. Aftertaste shows a lighter flavour with roasted malt and some cardboard tastes to finish up the flavour. Overall, a pretty decent beer compared to the other typical lagers you get here in South Korea - but compared to other stouts, it’s definitely not up to par. I sampled this 33 cL can purchased at a local 7-11 near the Gubendari Subway stop on Line 5 in Seoul, South Korea on 23-July-2006.

out of all the local macro-brews in korea this was probalby one of the best ones that i have had, but that is not saying much.

pours a dark brown with a small off white head that dissaptes rapidly, some lacing.

smell is faint, malt, some caramel, and a touch of cocoa.

taste is watery, malt, some cocoa, and slightly bitter.

Bottled.  Poured deep reddish-brown with a creamy initial cap of beige head.  The aroma picked up some semi-sweet chocolate notes and a good deal more generic, sweeter black malts.. off notes akin to roasted vegetal mash (better executed than it sounds).. OK when all put together.  The flavor was also on the sweet side with cola, chocolate, and brown sugar representin’.. finished dry with sweet roasty black malts.  Lighter-bodied with scratchy carbonation on the palate.. sweet middle.. decent flow, but not very memorable.

Bottle courtesy of 5000.  Pours brown with a thin white head.  Smells of caramel, sugar, tea, some tartness.  Tastes of caramel and vegetal with some swetness on the finish.  Maybe I just got lucky with this bottle, but it’s not a sub-2.0 beer.

probably the best bottled beer I tried in Korea - but that isn’t saying much. Ignoring the fact that it’s mis-labelled as stout, this is a reasonable brown beer, slightly too sweet for my taste, but after the rest of the Hite range it came as a positive relief.
<i>Bottled. </i> Dark brown, almost no head. Papery and shallow, sweet and fruity. Lots of cardboard and some vegetables cover the caramelly malt. Finishes joyless without bitterness.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with a small vanishing tan head. Aroma is sweet malty. The flavour is roasted malt, sweet with hint of coffee. Very thin and watery. Drinkable compared to many other Korean macro brews, not really a stout.

33cl bottle that just said ’’black beer stout’’ and everything else was in Hangul.  Stout?  This really seemed more like a schwarzbier to me.  Not a great representation of either style but much too thin and light for a proper stout.  Not bad, just seems lost a bit.

So my wife brought this beer back from Korea.  It’s not in a can like the picture suggests, but in a twist off bottle that says ’black beer stout’ and very little else in english.  It’s gotta be Hite stout.  Dry aroma, more of a dank aroma than anything else.  Not really a roasted character to speak of.  There’s a thin coffee aspect I suppose.  Jet black, though the sparse head fell quickly and disappeared completely.  Super thin body.  There’s some cola here, I probably wouldn’t have picked up on it if it wasn’t for the previous rating.  Distracting and disappointing.  Drainpour.

V - thinnish cola like dark brown pour with a carby, no retention head

A - Touch of coffee but it’s quickly drowned out with a watery quality that again reminds me of soda

T - Some roasted malt taste but with a carbonated kick.

P - If I wanted cola, I would have bought cola.

bottled, twist off at that, poured dark brown like cola, no really, it looks like cola with mild tan head, slight roasted aroma, light on the palate for a stout with roasted sweet malt flavors, no real lasting flavor, not bad, but not great.

330ml bottle from Bottleworks; nose of a slight roastiness with a mild diacetyl note; clear brown with a big tan head; flavor is slightly sweet with a very small hop bitterness and a light coffee note. Body very watery. Not much of a stout!
Bottle @ Maria tasting. Red brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted, butterscotch, burned sugar. Flavour is sweet, burned sugar, butterscotch, rosted. Thin beer and no typical stout.

bottle - Pours brown.  It’s not even very dark brown, just brown.  Warning!  Warning!  Stouts should be darker than this beer.  It has a light roast malt aroma.  It’s sweet with a mild roast malt flavor and not much else.  Light bodied, it’s not a bad flavor, but is well off the mark of a stout.  I’m not sure what they were thinking here.

Bottle, thx to Maria. It pours a dark ruby to brown body with a beige head. Grainy, roasted, coffeeish aroma with toffee and butterscotch. Butterscotch in the flavor too, but here it dominates, with some fruityness and coffee added. Medium body. Sweet, roasted, butterscotch finish. Drinkable, but far from being a good stout. (080412)

Bottle Pours out a BROWN (hello right on the bottle it said BLACK Beer about 5 times???) Well next. This black (brown) beer has a small off white head. Aroma of ligth malt. Tast of light malt and a touch of bitterness along with a touch of sweetness. AH I think I will pass next time.

Bottle @ Thisted Tasting by Maria.. Clear medium brown color with a average, fizzy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, roasted, bread, wet - sour malt, brown sugar. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (120408)
Clear dark brown of color with an off-white head. An aroma of roasted notes, plastic and sweet malt notes. A flavor of sweet notes, roasted hints and liqurice.

Tasting my place. Courtesy of After4ever! Brow/red with a quickly disappearing head. the aroma has sweetness and notes of wet, slightly burnt rye, straw and the flavour is sweet with notes of candy sugar, wet, slightly burnt rye and straw. It’s very atypical, thin and very sweet - but it’s a new country!

Bottle: Dark brown/blackish color. The nose is a touch roasty with some vanilla and mallow along with some milk chocolate and ample carbonation. The flavor is bright and fizzy with some sweet olive and carob notes with some residual tart licorice and powdered milk. For sure an asian stout with the restrained malt, hops and flavor.

Twist-top bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a fading off-white head. Smells more like a dark lager than a stout. Light body and strong, fizzy carbonation. Reminds me a bit of Coca-Cola, but not quite as sweet. Either this isn’t really a stout... or it’s entirely possible that they inadvertently left the leading "S" off the name.
Dark burgundy-brown.  Somewhat oily, cheap coffee nose.  Thin...really thin.  Hollowed-out flavours of nuts, coffee and molasses...it’s there but it’s a gutted, empty brew.

330 (bottle). Black with a loose, sloppy white head. Stouts should not have white head. I know I make a point to anyone who will listen that styles are free like butterflies to be whatever they want to be, but this is like a man wearing white jeans. It just looks wrong. Thankfully, it falls quickly away to almost nothing, no lace, no film. Sweet molasses and corn with some fusels on the nose--gad, what a mess. Soft, fairly light body with mild carb. Fusels, corn, cardboard, and some sweet roasty malty notes on the mid-palate. Chemically finish. Not much of a beer.

330ml bottle the nescafe of the stout world - seemed like a very thin mild to me. A roasty nose on this very dark brown beer with a large lasting off white head gives way to a very thin malty beer with a slightly bitter caramel aftertaste. The roasty mouthfeel is just dissernable through the high carbonation.  Could easily be just hite with added caramel to darken it.

Bottle. Dark brown with reddish hue, but very clear. Thin beige head that disappears quickly. Very little aroma - maybe vanilla. Thin body with fairly lively carbonation. The flavour is not a stout, but not unpleasant. It is malty with some bitterness, but not a lot. There are some other interesting flavours, although they are not prominent. I get chocolatey tastes and caramael and what seems to me rather like black sesame in the finish. It’s not a stout, but for a Korean beer it has some interesting dimensions to it.

Had this from a bottle while trolling for college age Korean chicks in Sangsu (Heong Dae) Seoul.  Nose of caramel and flowers, very faint.  Pours a clear garnet/walnut.  Beige frothy head for about 4 seconds.  No lace.  Really kinda like a brown ale ----> see newcastle brown.  Very malty and nutty finish suggestive of caramel.  The watery body is light and lively, the finish feels chalky.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown.  This is a stout? Okay...  The aroma is strange.  I smell rice and maybe malt from a low end beer.  My nose does not lie.  The taste:  Very light!  Flavor is indescribably unpleasant.  Very dark lager-like, but in a bad way.  Very one dimensional.

It was quite good, it was smooth and easy to drink. Goes well with food, but not a high-end beer. It’s a generic stout, and is slightly better than other generic beers around. I would take it over any korean beer or generic beer to date. The bitterness is surprisingly subtle and although it’s not a beer to try for outstanding taste, it still has a decent taste, better than what you can say for other generic beers.
12 oz bottle.  Light brown and strangely transparent.  Smells like a shitty pale lager with a hint of licorice.  Thin and watery with the flavour of dirty dishwater.  Terrible really.

From a can date-stamped four weeks earlier, pours a light brown color with fast-fading tan head of fine bubbles. Light body with slightly dry caramel flavor with hints of drier roasted character. Well-carbonated. Thin finish, clean but little character. Not close to being a stout.

Possibly the most misnamed beer ever.  This ’stout’ is blackish (I’ll give it that..) but thats where the similarities end.  The head is non existent even with a direct pour and the aroma is MIA.  The flavor is slightly better than some beers I’ve had, but this is by no means a repeat beer.  Maybe Korea has more to offer...

12oz bottle via trade with beastiefan2k - Thanks Eugene! - Pours brown with a fizzy tan head that fades back to a quarter inch and stays well there.  Aromas of roasted malt and really not much else.  Flavor starts out of chocolate milk but moves to malted milk balls quick then maybe some slight nutty characterististics before the somewhat watered down finish.  Palate is unbelievably thin and watery with odd carbonation.  Not terrible to drink but not exactly what i"m looking for when I reach for a stout.

Can. Brown, not black as the can says. Large, rapidly shrinking head. Nice aroma of roasted malt, a little dryness, too. A bit too thin and watery. And I’m not sure if this is a real stout or a Vienna.

Thin, watery body with minimal head. Cool black color but the flavor......yech. Sweet, sweet, sweet, with some vanilla and malt notes. No hop or roasty malt character whatsoverver. Not sure why this is considered a stout.

Cocacola body, small khaki head, laces ok. Aroma is vanilla, almond, light malt, chocolate, roasted nuts. Taste is watery, a little sweet, no bittering, just sweet chocolate and nuts. Aftertaste is malt. Brought to me from Korea by jeremy

Thanks Jeremy for bringing back this beer from Seoul! Pours a somewhat claer, dark brown color with a thin head. Dark malt aroma. Very watery taste. Faint caramel taste. Kind of a skunky aftertaste. More like a brown ale than a stout!

Medium-sized coarse-laced light beige head subsides quickly. Deep dark red body with ongoing carbonation. Faint caramel aroma with touches of sugar. Watery burnt taste initially, then light caramel and licorice. Faint chocolate. Faintly bitter and dry aftertaste. Ok, but way too little body. (0.33l bottle.)
